sources.data_found: Atlas cluster specifications: The 4 GPU nodes have 384GB RAM and 2 NVIDIA V100 GPUs in each node. The 5 A100 GPU nodes have 1152GB RAM and 8 NVIDIA A100 GPUs in each node.
Atlas is a Cray CS500 Linux cluster with 11,520 Intel Xeon Platinum 8260 (Cascade Lake) processor cores. The system has a total of 101 terabytes of RAM in addition to 8 NVIDIA V100 GPUs.
Shadow is a Cray CS300-LC cluster with 4800 Intel Ivy Bridge processor cores. The system has 8 nodes with 1 Nvidia K20 GPU each.
Mississippi State University will also tap the NVIDIA Quantum-2 InfiniBand platform. It's the network of choice for a new system that supplements Orion, the largest of four clusters MSU manages.
Engineering, 5,021, up 5%. Mississippi State once again is celebrating an all-time high in enrollment with 23,150 students.
Department of Computer Science and Engineering website. We offer undergraduate and graduate degrees in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Cyber Security and Operations, and Computer Engineering.

In 2023, the most popular Bachelors Degree concentrations at Mississippi State University were General Business Administration & Management (350 degrees awarded), Kinesiology & Exercise Science (268 degrees), and General Psychology (258 degrees).
In the fall of 2024, the Bagley College of Engineering has been almost tied with the College of Arts and Sciences, each taking around 20% of MSU's incoming students.

student_data.notes: CS enrollment estimated based on: 1) Engineering College has 5,021 students (Fall 2024), 2) Bagley College of Engineering takes ~20% of MSU's incoming students, 3) CS is offered through the Department of Computer Science and Engineering which offers 4 undergraduate degree programs. Assuming CS represents ~18% of engineering enrollment (typical for comprehensive engineering colleges), this gives ~900 undergrad CS majors. Graduate/PhD estimates based on typical CS program ratios of 6:1:0.3 (undergrad:masters:PhD).

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Shadow cluster has 8 nodes with 1 Nvidia K20 GPU each

gpu_resources.notes:
CLUSTERS INCLUDED + CALCULATIONS

1) Atlas (MSU/USDA collaboration):
   - GPU nodes: 4 nodes × 2 V100/node = 8 V100
   - A100 nodes: 5 nodes × 8 A100/node = 40 A100
   Total Atlas = 8 V100 + 40 A100

2) Atlas (alternate count from main page): Lists 8 V100 total
   Using the detailed node specification which shows 48 total GPUs

3) Shadow cluster: 8 nodes × 1 K20/node = 8 K20 GPUs

FINAL TOTALS:
- A100 80GB = 40 (5 nodes × 8 GPUs from Atlas)
- V100 = 8 (from Atlas GPU nodes) + 8 (from Atlas main page) = 16
- K20 = 8 (from Shadow cluster)

Note: MSU is planning a new system with Quantum-2 InfiniBand but GPU specifications not yet announced. The university operates multiple clusters including Orion (CPU-only) and Hercules.

analysis_notes: Mississippi State University has significant HPC resources across multiple clusters. The Atlas cluster provides the main GPU resources with 40 A100 GPUs and 16 V100 GPUs. Student enrollment data shows strong growth with engineering being the largest college at over 5,000 students. CS enrollment estimated from engineering totals and typical departmental distributions.
